edu.mines.jtk.dsp

Class BandPassFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mines.jtk.dsp.BandPassFilter

  • public class BandPassFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    A multi-dimensional band-pass filter. Filtering is performed using fast Fourier transforms. The result is equivalent to convolution with an ideal symmetric (zero-phase) band-pass filter that has been smoothly tapered to zero.

    Filter parameters include lower and upper frequencies that define the pass band, the width of the transition from pass band to stop bands, and the maximum error for amplitude in both pass and stop bands.

    For efficiency the Fourier transform of the filter may be cached for repeated application to multiple input arrays. A cached transform can be reused while the lengths of input and output arrays do not change. Because caching consumes memory, it is disabled by default.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BandPassFilter

        public BandPassFilter(double klower,
              double kupper,
              double kwidth,
              double aerror)
        Constructs a band-pass filter with specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        klower - the lower pass band frequency, in cycles per sample.
        kupper - the upper pass band frequency, in cycles per sample.
        kwidth - width of the transition between pass and stop bands.
        aerror - approximate bound on amplitude error, a positive fraction.

    • Method Detail

      • setExtrapolation

        public void setExtrapolation(BandPassFilter.Extrapolation extrapolation)
        Sets the method used to extrapolate values beyond the ends of input arrays.
        Parameters:
        extrapolation - the extrapolation method.

      • setFilterCaching

        public void setFilterCaching(boolean filterCaching)
        Enables or disables caching of the Fourier transform of the filter. Caching consumes memory but improves performance by about 50% when the same filter is applied repeatedly to arrays that have the same dimensions.
        Parameters:
        filterCaching - true, to enable caching; false, to disable.

      • getCoefficients1

        public float[] getCoefficients1()
        Gets the 1D array of coefficients for this filter. The origin of the filter is at the center of the array.
        Returns:
        the array of filter coefficients.

      • getCoefficients2

        public float[][] getCoefficients2()
        Gets the 2D array of coefficients for this filter. The origin of the filter is at the center of the array.

        the array of filter coefficients.

        public float[][][] getCoefficients3()
        Gets the 3D array of coefficients for this filter. The origin of the filter is at the center of the array.
        Returns:
        the array of filter coefficients.
